error_analysis.summary: pip-audit failed because the '--strict' flag is incompatible with the '--skip-editable' flag's behavior. The '--skip-editable' flag suppresses the audit for 'aifactory-os', but it still registers a warning-level event ('distribution marked as editable'). The '--strict' flag then escalates this warning into a fatal error, causing the command to fail.

original_problem_root_cause: The root cause remains that 'aifactory-os' is a local, editable package not found on PyPI. The tool's '--strict' mode is correctly identifying this as an abnormal state and failing the build, even when told to skip the package.

resolution_options.description: Remove the '--strict' flag to resolve the conflict. The '--skip-editable' flag will then correctly skip the 'aifactory-os' package and suppress the 'editable' warning without it being escalated to a fatal error.
resolution_options.notes: This is the most direct solution. It will skip your local package and allow the audit to pass. The trade-off is that 'pip-audit' will no longer fail on other non-vulnerability errors (like network issues), as '--strict' will be disabled.

recommended_action: Implement 'solution_id: 1_remove_strict_flag'. This accepts the trade-off that non-vulnerability errors will be reported as warnings instead of failures, which is necessary to successfully skip an editable package.
